<p>a. Instill in the lower lid with lower lid everted while patient looks up and slightly tilts head backwards with hyperextension of the neck (Figure 4-7)
b. Avoid touching the dropper on the eyelid
c. Hold pressure on the lacrimal sac for 1 to 3 minutes after instillation to decrease risk of sinus and systemic absorption
d. Wait 2 to 3 minutes before instilling another drop</p>
<ol start="5">
<li>Topical</li>
</ol>
<p>a. Use gloves for application of creams
b. Date the outside of transdermal patches
c. Apply a clear plastic wrap over nitroglycerin (NTG) ointment paper, which will increase the absorption
d. Rotate sites to prevent irritation to the skin; cleanse old site after patch removal</p>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251221-c7aba6cd.jpeg" alt="img-10.jpeg">
Figure 4-7. Administering ophthalmic ointment. To instill ointment, gently pull lower lid down as patient looks upward. Squeeze ophthalmic ointment into lower sac. Avoid touching tube to eyelid. (From Clark J et al: Pharmacologic basis of nursing practice, ed 4, St Louis, 1993, Mosby.)</p>
<p>KEY PRINCIPLES—IV ROUTE ▼ 55</p>
<p>e. Do not shave hairy areas because shaving may inflame the skin, which then increases absorption</p>
<p>E. Intravenous (IV): into a vein</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p>Know how fast an intravenous push (IVP) should be given or an intravenous piggyback (IVPB) should be run. The literature identifies certain limits for some IVP medications. Most IVP medications should be given over at least 1 to 3 minutes, IVPB over 30 minutes.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Use sterile technique for all forms of IV administration</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Wear gloves during administration to protect self from blood-borne diseases</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Monitor for signs and symptoms of</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>a. Phlebitis: inflammation of a vein: redness, warmth, pain
b. Infiltration: when the fluid passes into the tissue: pallor, edema, coolness, decreased IV flow</p>
<ol start="5">
<li>
<p>Do not rely on an IV pump alone; check the accuracy of the flow rate</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Cleanse the ports on the IV tubing with a disinfectant before using the port for an IVP or IVPB; if needleless system, discard used caps and apply sterile ones</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Never push medicines through a difficult or clogged IV line</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Know which medications can and cannot be mixed together. If medications do not mix, flush with sterile water or normal saline (NS) before administering, or use another site. Example: diazepam (Valium) cannot be mixed with any other medications or diluted with NS.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Know the hospital protocol for rotating IV peripheral sites; usual recommendation is every 72 hours</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Prime the IV line before beginning infusion and include all ports</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Know which medications need filters. IV substances usually not filtered.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>a. Lipids
b. Amphotericin B
c. tPA Activase
d. Insulin
e. Nitroglycerine</p>
<ol start="12">
<li>Monitor for common complications of IV therapy</li>
</ol>
<p>a. Infiltration or extravasation: the process whereby a fluid or drug passes into the tissues
b. Thrombophlebitis: inflammation of a vein, often accompanied by a clot</p>
<p>CHAPTER 4 ADMINISTRATION OF MEDICATIONS</p>
<p>c. Pain
d. Fluid overload: excess accumulation of intravascular fluid; may be manifested by pulmonary edema
e. Infusion-related infection: contamination of the IV system, site, or solution; manifested by purulent drainage, cellulitis, erythema, pain, thrombophlebitis
f. Tissue necrosis: localized tissue death that occurs in groups of cells in response to disease or injury</p>
<ol start="13">
<li>Avoid taping over the needle; insertion site needs to be easily viewed at all times</li>
<li>Know care differences for IV central lines—major action is to prevent air embolism with tubing change by closing clamp near insertion site, have client bear down or hold breath, (Valsalva maneuver) and then change tubing</li>
</ol>
<p>F. Venous Access Device (Venous Access Port—VAP): Internal surgically implanted catheter placed in the chest wall, abdomen, or antecubital area of the arm designed for continuous access to the venous system. Examples: Port-a-Cath, Infuse-a-Port, Mediport, Chemo-Port.</p>
<ol>
<li>Secure the implanted device with two fingers before injecting (Figure 4-8)</li>
<li>Cleanse site with povidone iodine (Betadine) before puncture</li>
<li>Aspirate for a blood return</li>
<li>Irrigate with sterile water or saline prior to and after administering the medication</li>
</ol>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251221-27beb1f6.jpeg" alt="img-11.jpeg">
Figure 4-8. Implanted infusion device. A, Side view illustrating needle inserted through skin and top of infusion device. Distal end of device is in vein. B, Use one hand to secure device before inserting needle. (From Clark J et al: Pharmacologic basis of nursing practice, ed 4, St Louis, 1993, Mosby.)</p>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251221-c4174fdf.jpeg" alt="img-12.jpeg"></p>
<p>GUIDELINES FOR NEEDLE SELECTION; CALCULATION OF DOSAGES—THREE FORMULAS ▼ 57</p>
<ol start="5">
<li>Recommended needle size is no. 20 to 22 gauge, commonly Hubor point straight or 90 degree angled needle with a no. 22 gauge used</li>
</ol>
<p>G. Venous Access Device: External central VAD—most common are Hickman, Broviac, and Groshong. Care is similar to care of an IV central line.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="iv-needles">IV. Needles<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#iv-needles" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>A. Intradermal (ID)
26 gauge (g): ¼ or ⅜ inches</p>
<p>B. Intramuscular (IM)
22 g: 1 to 1½ inches
16 to 18 g: 2 to 3 inches for penicillin injections</p>
<p>C. Subcutaneous (SQ)
25 or 26 g: ½ to ⅝ inches</p>
<p>D. Intravenous (IV)
18 to 22 g: general IV
14 to 20 g: blood transfusion</p>
<p>E. Huber needle—especially designed needle with a sharp-angle bevel used only for implanted VAD: can be either no. 22 straight or 90 degree angled (right angled) needle</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="v-calculation-of-dosages-can-be-accomplished-by-three-formulas">V. Calculation of dosages can be accomplished by three formulas<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#v-calculation-of-dosages-can-be-accomplished-by-three-formulas" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>A. Desired/Have: 50 mg ordered, have on hand 100 mg/2 cc</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p>Formula: <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mtext>Desired&nbsp;dose</mtext><mtext>Have&nbsp;on&nbsp;hand</mtext></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mtext>Quantity</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>Dosage&nbsp;to&nbsp;give</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{\text{Desired dose}}{\text{Have on hand}} \times \text{Quantity} = \text{Dosage to give}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.2251em; vertical-align: -0.345em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8801em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">Have&nbsp;on&nbsp;hand</span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.394em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">Desired&nbsp;dose</span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.345em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Quantity</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Dosage&nbsp;to&nbsp;give</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Example: <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>50</mn><mtext>&nbsp;mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn><mtext>&nbsp;mg</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext>&nbsp;cc</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>&nbsp;cc</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{50\ \text{mg}}{100\ \text{mg}} \times 2\ \text{cc} = 1\ \text{cc}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.3783em; vertical-align: -0.4811em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8972em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">100</span><span class="mspace mtight"><span class="mtight">&nbsp;</span></span><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">mg</span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.4461em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">50</span><span class="mspace mtight"><span class="mtight">&nbsp;</span></span><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">mg</span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.4811em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">2</span><span class="mspace">&nbsp;</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">cc</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mspace">&nbsp;</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">cc</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>B. Ratio-Proportion (RP): 50 mg ordered, have on hand 100 mg/2 cc</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p>Formula: <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mtext>Dosage&nbsp;on&nbsp;hand&nbsp;(units)</mtext><mtext>Dosage&nbsp;on&nbsp;hand&nbsp;(cc)</mtext></mfrac><mo>:</mo><mfrac><mtext>Desired&nbsp;dose&nbsp;(units)</mtext><mtext>Unknown&nbsp;X&nbsp;(cc)</mtext></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mtext>Dose&nbsp;to&nbsp;give</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{\text{Dosage on hand (units)}}{\text{Dosage on hand (cc)}} : \frac{\text{Desired dose (units)}}{\text{Unknown X (cc)}} = \text{Dose to give}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.53em; vertical-align: -0.52em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.01em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">Dosage&nbsp;on&nbsp;hand&nbsp;(cc)</span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.485em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">Dosage&nbsp;on&nbsp;hand&nbsp;(units)</span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.52em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">:</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.53em; vertical-align: -0.52em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.01em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">Unknown&nbsp;X&nbsp;(cc)</span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.485em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">Desired&nbsp;dose&nbsp;(units)</span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.52em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Dose&nbsp;to&nbsp;give</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Example: <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>100</mn><mtext>&nbsp;mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>&nbsp;cc</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>:</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>50</mn><mtext>&nbsp;mg</mtext></mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{100\ \text{mg}}{2\ \text{cc}} : \frac{50\ \text{mg}}{\text{X}}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.2422em; vertical-align: -0.345em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8972em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span><span class="mspace mtight"><span class="mtight">&nbsp;</span></span><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">cc</span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.4461em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">100</span><span class="mspace mtight"><span class="mtight">&nbsp;</span></span><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">mg</span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.345em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">:</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.2422em; vertical-align: -0.345em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8972em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">X</span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.4461em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">50</span><span class="mspace mtight"><span class="mtight">&nbsp;</span></span><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">mg</span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.345em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>CHAPTER 4 ADMINISTRATION OF MEDICATIONS</p>
<p>(Note: Cross multiply 50 mg with 2 cc and 100 mg with X)</p>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>100</mn><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>100</mn><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
100 \mathrm{mg} \mathrm{X} = 100 \mathrm{mg} \mathrm{cc} \\
\mathrm{X} = \frac{100 \mathrm{mg} \mathrm{cc}}{100 \mathrm{mg}} \\
\mathrm{X} = 1 \mathrm{cc} \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 3.7783em; vertical-align: -1.6392em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 2.1392em;"><span style="top: -4.2992em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">100</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm" style="margin-right: 0.01389em;">mg</span></span><span class="mord mathrm">X</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mord">100</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm" style="margin-right: 0.01389em;">mg</span></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">cc</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.0419em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">X</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8972em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">100</span><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathrm mtight" style="margin-right: 0.01389em;">mg</span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.4461em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">100</span><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathrm mtight" style="margin-right: 0.01389em;">mg</span></span><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathrm mtight">cc</span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.4811em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -1.7208em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">X</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">cc</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.6392em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<p>(Note: "mg" cancel out)</p>
<p>C. Dimensional analysis (DA): 50 mg ordered, have on hand 1 gr/2 cc</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p>Formula: Dose ordered × Conversion × Dose on hand = Dose to give or dose needed (all units should cancel except the desired dose)</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Example: 50 mg × <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>⋅</mo><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1000</mn><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{1 \cdot g}{1000 \mathrm{mg}}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.3783em; vertical-align: -0.4811em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8972em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1000</span><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathrm mtight" style="margin-right: 0.01389em;">mg</span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.4461em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span><span class="mbin mtight">⋅</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">g</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.4811em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span> × <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>15</mn><mo>⋅</mo><mi>g</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>⋅</mo><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{15 \cdot gr}{1 \cdot g}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.3783em; vertical-align: -0.4811em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8972em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span><span class="mbin mtight">⋅</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">g</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.4461em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">15</span><span class="mbin mtight">⋅</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">g</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">r</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.4811em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span> × <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⋅</mo><mi>c</mi><mi>c</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>⋅</mo><mi>g</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{2 \cdot cc}{1 \cdot gr}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.3262em; vertical-align: -0.4811em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8451em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span><span class="mbin mtight">⋅</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">g</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">r</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.394em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span><span class="mbin mtight">⋅</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">cc</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.4811em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span> = 1.5 cc</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>REVIEW QUESTIONS ▼ 59</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="review-questions">REVIEW QUESTIONS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#review-questions" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ol>
<li>
<p>Which client response below should make a nurse double-check the tablets, dose, and timing of the medication that has been prepared by the nurse?
a. “I don’t know what these are for”
b. “I’ve never taken a yellow one before”
c. “Can you tell me what these do?”
d. “The blue tablet always makes me sleepy”</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>An injection of iron dextran (Imferon) should be given Z-track on an adult client in which location?
a. Dorsogluteal
b. Ventrogluteal
c. Deltoid
d. Vastus lateralis</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Medications given by the nasogastric (NG) route require that
a. The medications are followed with formula
b. Heart sounds are assessed
c. 30 to 60 cc of water is instilled after medication instillation
d. All medications are crushed or liquid forms are used</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Which of these IV complications would be manifested by pallor, coolness of the skin, and edema at the site?
a. Tissue necrosis
b. Thrombophlebitis
c. Infiltration
d. Infection</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>A client complains of nausea and has hydroxyzine HCL (Vistaril) 50 mg IM q 4 hours prn. The nurse knows the medication must be given Z-track with a 0.5 cc airlock. The purpose of an airlock is so that the medication
a. Will completely clear the hub
b. Cannot leak out
c. Is accurately measured
d. Will not irritate the muscle</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>60 ▼ CHAPTER 4 ADMINISTRATION OF MEDICATIONS</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="answers-rationales-and-test-taking-tips">ANSWERS, RATIONALES, AND TEST-TAKING TIPS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#answers-rationales-and-test-taking-tips" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<table><thead><tr><th>Rationales</th><th>Test-Taking Tips</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><strong>1. Correct answer: b</strong></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Clients frequently know the shape, color, and number of tablets they take every day. Unless a new medication has been added, the nurse could have made a drug error. Clients may not know what every medication is for, especially if new medications were ordered. Clients frequently want to know what actions drugs have. Drowsiness is a common side effect and does not require rechecking the medications.</td><td>If you have no idea of the correct response, cluster responses <em>a</em> and <em>c</em> under “knowledge deficit.” Eliminate these. Also eliminate <em>d</em> since it reflects client familiarity. Then select response <em>b</em>.</td></tr><tr><td><strong>2. Correct answer: a</strong></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>The dorsogluteal is a large muscle used for injection of irritating drugs. The ventrogluteal is used for IM injections but is not the preferred location for Z-track. The deltoid muscle is too small. The vastus lateralis is used for IM but is not the preferred site for injecting irritating medications.</td><td>Easily remember that the ventrogluteal and the vastus lateralis are both given on the lateral aspect of the body for IM, and only as a second choice for deep IM, Z-track. An easy way to remember the difference between deltoid and dorsogluteal is that deltoid comes first alphabetically and also is the first site at the top of the body on the upper arm. Dorsogluteal is next alphabetically and is positioned lower on the body.</td></tr><tr><td><strong>3. Correct answer: c</strong></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Water flushes the tube, clearing all the medication and preventing clogging of the tube. Clients often need water</td><td>Eliminate response <em>d</em> that has the absolute “all.”</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>ANSWERS, RATIONALES, AND TEST-TAKING TIPS ▼ 61</p>
<p>separate from the formula and some of the medications may not mix with the ingredients of the formula. Heart sound assessment is not necessary for administration of NG medications. Time-released or enteric-coated tablets should never be crushed.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="4-correct-answer-c">4. Correct answer: c<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#4-correct-answer-c" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Infiltration is manifested by pallor, edema, and coolness because the fluid escapes into the tissue around the site. Tissue necrosis is manifested by warm, irritated, and usually red or purplish-red skin. Thrombophlebitis is manifested by warmth and redness. Infection would exhibit findings of redness, warmth, pain, and possibly pus.</p>
<p>If you have no idea of the correct response, try to cluster a, b, and c under “inflammatory response,” which is characteristically red. Since the given data states “pallor,” eliminate these three answers.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="5-correct-answer-a">5. Correct answer: a<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#5-correct-answer-a" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>An airlock clears all medication from the hub and needle, since the air clears after the medication. The Z-track method prevents medication from leaking back into the subcutaneous tissue. Accurate measurement should occur before the drawing up of an airlock. The Z-track method is used to prevent irritation of oil-based, caustic, or large amounts of IM medications.</p>
<p>Use your knowledge and common sense to picture the air and its purpose—to clear medication from the hub.</p>
<p>^{}[]</p>
<p>63
CHAPTER 5</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="drugs-affecting-the-autonomic-nervous-system">Drugs Affecting the Autonomic Nervous System<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#drugs-affecting-the-autonomic-nervous-system" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="study-outcomes">STUDY OUTCOMES<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#study-outcomes" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>After completing this chapter, the reader will be able to do the following:</p>
<ul>
<li>Identify the names of agents used to treat the sympathetic and parasympathetic nervous system.</li>
<li>Discuss the action, use, side effects, and nursing implications of cholinergic agents and cholinergic blocking agents.</li>
<li>Discuss the action, use, side effects, and nursing implications of adrenergic agents and adrenergic blocking agents.</li>
</ul>
<p>64 ▼ CHAPTER 5 DRUGS AFFECTING THE AUTONOMIC NERVOUS SYSTEM</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="key-terms">KEY TERMS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#key-terms" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p><strong>Adrenergic or sympathetic</strong>
Pertaining to the sympathetic nerve fibers that use the neurotransmitters, epinephrine, or epinephrine-like substances.</p>
<p><strong>Adrenergic agonists</strong>
Also called <em>sympathomimetic</em>. Drugs that cause an adrenergic response from the body.</p>
<p><strong>Adrenergic receptor</strong>
Two types: Alpha receptor—stimulation of results in an excitatory response. Beta receptor—stimulation of results in an inhibitory response.</p>
<p><strong>Adrenergic response</strong>
A sympathetic-like response such as increased heart rate, peripheral vasoconstriction, and increased serum glucose.</p>
<p><strong>Antiadrenergic</strong>
Pertaining to the blocking effects of impulses transmitted by the adrenergic fibers of the sympathetic system. Examples: alpha adrenergic and beta adrenergic blocker agents.</p>
<p><strong>Cardiac terminology</strong>
Clinically discussed in terms of positive, meaning a faster or stronger response, and negative, meaning a slower or weaker response.</p>
<p><strong>Chronotropic</strong>
The act or process of affecting the rate of the heart.</p>
<p><strong>Dromotropic</strong>
The act or process of affecting the conduction through the heart.</p>
<p><strong>Inotropic</strong>
The act or process of affecting the contractility of the heart.</p>
<p><strong>Cholinergic</strong>
Pertaining to the nerve fibers that elaborate acetylcholine at the myoneural junctions; maintains normal, day-to-day functions of the body.</p>
<p><strong>Cholinergic blocking, anticholinergic agents</strong>
Pertaining to a substance that blocks the acetylcholine receptors or competes with acetylcholine for its receptor sites.</p>
<p><strong>Cholinergic response, parasympathomimetic, cholinergic agents</strong>
Pertaining to a substance that produces effects similar to those from the stimulation of the cholinergic system.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="content-review">CONTENT REVIEW<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#content-review" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="8538d533">ADRENERGIC AGENTS—SYMPATHOMIMETIC<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#8538d533" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="i-adrenergic-agonists">I. Adrenergic agonists<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#i-adrenergic-agonists" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h4 level="4" id="a-division-table-5-1">A. Division (Table 5-1)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#a-division-table-5-1" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h4></div>
<p>ADRENERGICS, CLASSIFICATION OF AUTONOMIC NERVOUS SYSTEM DRUGS ▼ 65</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="table-5-1-classification-of-autonomic-nervous-system-drugs">Table 5-1. Classification of Autonomic Nervous System Drugs<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#table-5-1-classification-of-autonomic-nervous-system-drugs" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<table><thead><tr><th>Sympathetic</th><th></th><th>Parasympathetic</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><strong>Adrenergic Response</strong></td><td></td><td><strong>Cholinergic Response</strong></td></tr><tr><td>Catecholamines:</td><td></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>norepinephrine</td><td><strong>Neurotransmitters</strong></td><td>Acetylcholine ACh</td></tr><tr><td>epinephrine</td><td></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>dopamine</td><td></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Beta 1</td><td><strong>Receptor Sites</strong></td><td>Nicotinic</td></tr><tr><td>Beta 2</td><td></td><td>Muscarinic</td></tr><tr><td>Alpha</td><td></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Dopaminergic</td><td></td><td></td></tr><tr><td><strong>Agents</strong></td><td></td><td></td></tr><tr><td><strong>Adrenergic Drugs</strong></td><td></td><td><strong>Cholinergic Agents</strong></td></tr><tr><td>(Sympathomimetic)</td><td></td><td>(Parasympathomimetic)</td></tr><tr><td>▼ Catecholamines</td><td></td><td>▼ Direct-Acting</td></tr><tr><td>▼ Noncatecholamines</td><td></td><td>Cholinergic Agents</td></tr><tr><td><strong>Adrenergic Blocking</strong></td><td></td><td>▼ Anticholinesterase</td></tr><tr><td>Agents (Sympatholytic)</td><td></td><td>Agents</td></tr><tr><td>▼ Alpha Adrenergic Blockers</td><td></td><td><strong>Cholinergic Blocking</strong></td></tr><tr><td>▼ Beta Adrenergic Blockers</td><td></td><td>(Parasympatholytic)</td></tr><tr><td>▼ Ganglionic Blockers</td><td></td><td>Anticholinergic Agents</td></tr></tbody></table>
<ol>
<li>Includes Alpha₁, Alpha₂, Beta₁, Beta₂, and dopamine agonists</li>
<li>Divided into two groups
a. Catecholamines: a group of sympathomimetic compounds that cannot cross the blood-brain barrier, act directly, or be taken orally
(1) Those that are endogenous: norepinephrine, epinephrine and dopamine
(2) Those that are synthetic: dobutamine, isoproterenol
b. Noncatecholamines: compounds that can cross the blood-brain barrier, act directly or indirectly, and be taken orally: ephedrine, albuterol, phenylephrine
B. Catecholamines</li>
<li>Actions (Table 5-2)
a. +inotropic: increase force or contraction of heart
b. +chronotropic: increase rate of heartbeat</li>
</ol>
<p>66 ▼ CHAPTER 5 DRUGS AFFECTING THE AUTONOMIC NERVOUS SYSTEM</p>
<p>c. +dromotropic: increase conduction of impulse
d. adrenergic neurotransmission</p>
<ol start="2">
<li>
<p>Uses
a. Hypotension
b. Anaphylactic shock
c. Asthma
d. Hypoglycemia
e. Control bleeding—usually local
f. Local anesthetic
g. Congestive heart failure (CHF)
h. Mild renal failure</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Major side effects
a. Tachycardia
b. Hypertension
c. Myocardial ischemia
d. Hyperglycemia</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Nursing implications
a. Monitor vital signs (VS) and ECG
b. Assess respiratory effort and lung sounds</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Table 5-2. Autonomic Action of Cardiovascular Medications</p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Action</th><th>Refers To</th><th>To Increase</th><th>To Decrease</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Contractility</td><td>Stretch</td><td>+ Inotropic</td><td>– Inotropic</td></tr><tr><td>Heart Rate</td><td>Rate</td><td>+ Chronotropic</td><td>– Chronotropic</td></tr><tr><td>Conduction</td><td>Speed of electrical impulse transmission through the heart</td><td>+ Dromotropic</td><td>– Dromotropic</td></tr><tr><td></td><td></td><td>Positive</td><td>Negative</td></tr><tr><td>Inotropic effects:</td><td>cardiac output</td><td>↑</td><td>↓</td></tr><tr><td></td><td>urinary output</td><td>↑</td><td>↓</td></tr><tr><td></td><td>cardiac workload</td><td>↑</td><td>↓</td></tr><tr><td>Chronotropic effects:</td><td>+ tachycardia or increase in heart rate</td><td></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>– bradycardia or decrease in heart rate</td><td></td><td></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>Dromotropic effects:</td><td>+ attribute to dysrhythmias</td><td></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>– decrease in dysrhythmias</td><td></td><td></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>+ = positive</td><td></td><td></td><td></td></tr><tr><td>– = negative</td><td></td><td></td><td></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>AUTONOMIC ACTIONS OF CV DRUGS, ALPHA ADRENERGIC BLOCKERS ▼ 67</p>
<p>c. Monitor blood glucose levels
d. Monitor intake and output (I&amp;O)
e. Avoid extravasation</p>
<ol start="5">
<li>Common drugs
a. Epinephrine hydrochloride (Adrenalin Chloride)
b. Dobutamine hydrochloride (Dobutrex)
c. Dopamine hydrochloride (Inotropin)
d. Isoproterenol hydrochloride (Isuprel)
e. Norepinephrine bitartrate (Levophed)</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="c-noncatecholamines">C. Noncatecholamines<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#c-noncatecholamines" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>Action: selective catecholamine action because of their similarity</li>
<li>Uses
a. Asthma
b. Nasal decongestion
c. Premature labor
d. Hypotension</li>
<li>Major side effects
a. CNS reactions: nervousness, anxiety, headache, insomnia
b. ECG changes: palpitations, tachycardia, dysrhythmias
c. Musculoskeletal: weakness, mild tremors, and cramps</li>
<li>Nursing implications
a. Monitor vital signs, mental status
b. Teach client how to properly administer inhalants</li>
<li>Common drugs
a. Terbutaline sulfate (Brethine)
b. Albuterol (Proventil, Ventolin)
c. Metaproterenol sulfate (Alupent)
d. Phenylephrine hydrochloride (Neo-Synephrine)</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="adrenergic-blocking-agents">ADRENERGIC BLOCKING AGENTS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#adrenergic-blocking-agents" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="i-divided-into-three-groups-see-table-5-1">I. Divided into three groups (see Table 5-1)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#i-divided-into-three-groups-see-table-5-1" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>A. Alpha adrenergic blockers
B. Beta adrenergic blockers
C. Ganglionic blockers</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="ii-alpha-adrenergic-blockers">II. Alpha adrenergic blockers<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#ii-alpha-adrenergic-blockers" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h4 level="4" id="a-actions">A. Actions<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#a-actions" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h4></div>
<ol>
<li>Interrupt or antagonize the sympathomimetic agents</li>
<li>Vasodilate vascular smooth muscle</li>
<li>Lower peripheral vascular resistance</li>
</ol>
<p>68 ▼ CHAPTER 5 DRUGS AFFECTING THE AUTONOMIC NERVOUS SYSTEM</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="b-uses">B. Uses<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#b-uses" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Peripheral vascular disease</li>
<li>Raynaud’s disease</li>
<li>Pheochromocytoma</li>
<li>Hypertension</li>
<li>Vascular headaches (especially migraine)</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="c-major-side-effects">C. Major side effects<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#c-major-side-effects" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Nasal congestion</li>
<li>Gastrointestinal irritation, nausea, vomiting</li>
<li>Ergotism: an acute or chronic disease caused by excessive dosages of medications containing ergot; symptoms may include cerebrospinal findings such as spasms, cramps, or dry gangrene of the upper or lower extremities</li>
<li>Rebound tachycardia: sudden return of the heart rate to greater than 100 beats/min</li>
<li>Postural hypotension: drop in blood pressure greater than 20 mm Hg when client changes from a lying to a standing or a lying to a sitting position</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="d-nursing-implications">D. Nursing implications<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#d-nursing-implications" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Monitor vital signs; take lying, sitting, and standing BPs</li>
<li>Instruct the client to change positions slowly</li>
<li>For headaches, instruct the client to take the medication at the first sign of the attack</li>
<li>Assess for signs of ergotism: numbness, weakness, tingling of fingers and toes</li>
<li>Instruct the client how to take ergotamine products; usually taken every hour until the headache is gone or a maximum of 5 pills is taken</li>
<li>Instruct client to limit caffeine intake, since caffeine causes vasoconstriction</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="e-common-drugs">E. Common drugs<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#e-common-drugs" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Ergotamine tartrate (Ergostat)</li>
<li>Ergotamine tartrate and caffeine (Cafergot)</li>
<li>Phentolamine mesylate (Regitine)</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="iii-beta-adrenergic-blockers">III. Beta adrenergic blockers<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#iii-beta-adrenergic-blockers" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="a-actions-block-sympathetic-response-by-competing-for-beta-receptors-also-block-stimulation-of-the-heart-and-have-the-potential-to-block-bronchodilation">A. Actions: block sympathetic response by competing for beta receptors; also block stimulation of the heart and have the potential to block bronchodilation<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#a-actions-block-sympathetic-response-by-competing-for-beta-receptors-also-block-stimulation-of-the-heart-and-have-the-potential-to-block-bronchodilation" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="b-uses">B. Uses<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#b-uses" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>Hypertension</li>
<li>Angina</li>
</ol>
<p>BETA ADRENERGIC AND GANGLIONIC BLOCKERS ▼ 69</p>
<ol start="3">
<li>Tachyarrhythmias</li>
<li>Migraine headaches</li>
<li>Myocardial infarction</li>
<li>Anxiety</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="c-major-side-effects">C. Major side effects<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#c-major-side-effects" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>Bradycardia</li>
<li>Hypoglycemia</li>
<li>Orthostatic hypotension</li>
<li>Impotence</li>
<li>Bronchospasm, especially with asthma and other COPD clients</li>
<li>Depression</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="d-these-drugs-interact-with-alcohol-and-central-nervous-system-depressants">D. These drugs interact with alcohol and central nervous system depressants<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#d-these-drugs-interact-with-alcohol-and-central-nervous-system-depressants" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="e-nursing-implications">E. Nursing implications<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#e-nursing-implications" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>Monitor vital signs for bradycardia and hypotension</li>
<li>Monitor blood glucose for hypoglycemia: blood sugar &lt;50</li>
<li>Instruct client to monitor pulse, BP, and to change positions slowly</li>
<li>Advise the client about the possibility of impotence</li>
<li>Assess lung sounds for inspiratory and expiratory wheezing</li>
<li>Avoid extreme heat, hot tubs, hot showers</li>
<li>Advise the client not to use OTC drugs such as decongestants unless directed by a physician</li>
<li>Monitor for a need to increase dosage since these drugs are affected by the hepatic first-pass effect</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="f-common-drugs">F. Common drugs<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#f-common-drugs" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>Atenolol (Tenormin)</li>
<li>Timolol maleate (Inderal)</li>
<li>Metoprolol tartrate (Lopressor)</li>
<li>Nadolol (Corgard)</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="iv-ganglionic-blockers">IV. Ganglionic blockers<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#iv-ganglionic-blockers" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h4 level="4" id="a-action-compete-with-acetylcholine-and-affect-both-sympathetic-and-parasympathetic-systems">A. Action: compete with acetylcholine and affect both sympathetic and parasympathetic systems<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#a-action-compete-with-acetylcholine-and-affect-both-sympathetic-and-parasympathetic-systems" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h4></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h4 level="4" id="b-uses">B. Uses<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#b-uses" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h4></div>
<ol>
<li>Hypertension especially hypertensive crisis</li>
<li>Pulmonary edema resulting from pulmonary hypertension</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h4 level="4" id="c-major-side-effects">C. Major side effects<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#c-major-side-effects" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h4></div>
<ol>
<li>Hypotension</li>
<li>Bradycardia</li>
<li>Anticholinergic effects: dry mouth, dilated pupils, tachycardia, decreased GI and urinary motility</li>
</ol>
<p>70 ▼ CHAPTER 5 DRUGS AFFECTING THE AUTONOMIC NERVOUS SYSTEM</p>
<p>D. <strong>Nursing implications</strong></p>
<ol>
<li>Monitor BP and HR</li>
<li>Provide comfort measures for anticholinergic side effects</li>
</ol>
<p>E. <strong>Common drugs</strong></p>
<ol>
<li>Mecamylamine hydrochloride (Inversine)</li>
<li>Trimethaphan camsylate (Arfonad)</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="9b622853">CHOLINERGIC AGENTS—PARASYMPATHOMIMETIC<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#9b622853" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="i-divided-into-the-following-see-table-5-1">I. Divided into the following (see Table 5-1)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#i-divided-into-the-following-see-table-5-1" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>A. Direct-acting cholinergic agonists
B. Anticholinesterase agents</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="ii-direct-acting-cholinergic-agonists">II. Direct-acting cholinergic agonists<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#ii-direct-acting-cholinergic-agonists" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>A. <strong>Action</strong>: mimics acetylcholine to produce parasympathetic stimulation
B. <strong>Uses</strong></p>
<ol>
<li>Glaucoma</li>
<li>Bladder atony
C. <strong>Major side effects</strong></li>
<li>Bronchoconstriction, wheezing, shortness of breath</li>
<li>Bradycardia, hypotension</li>
<li>Headache, flushing</li>
<li>Increased salivation, sweating</li>
<li>Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, cramping
D. <strong>Interactions</strong>: decrease in action when given with adrenergic drugs
E. <strong>Nursing implications</strong></li>
<li>Assess respiratory and cardiac status</li>
<li>Instruct client to take before or after meals to limit gastrointestinal symptoms</li>
<li>Have atropine sulfate, an anticholinergic, available for emergency reactions</li>
<li>Instruct client how to instill eye drops if ordered. Eye drops for glaucoma have a miotic effect to constrict the pupil.
F. <strong>Common drugs</strong></li>
<li>Bethanechol chloride (Urecholine)—for bladder atony</li>
<li>Pilocarpine hydrochloride (Pilocar)—for glaucoma</li>
<li>Carbachol intraocular (Miostat)—for glaucoma</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="iii-anticholinesterase-agents">III. Anticholinesterase agents<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#iii-anticholinesterase-agents" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>A. <strong>Action</strong>: inhibit the enzyme acetylcholinesterase, which breaks down acetylcholine</p>
<p>CHOLINERGIC, ANTICHOLINESTERASE, AND ANTICHOLINERGIC AGENTS ▼ 71</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="b-uses">B. Uses<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#b-uses" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Myasthenia gravis</li>
<li>Glaucoma</li>
<li>Postoperative complications of bladder distention or paralytic ileus</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="c-major-side-effects">C. Major side effects<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#c-major-side-effects" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>GI distress: nausea, vomiting, diarrhea</li>
<li>Bradycardia, hypotension</li>
<li>Diaphoresis, increased salivation</li>
<li>Muscle cramps, fatigue, weakness, paralysis</li>
<li>Respiratory depression</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="d-nursing-implications">D. Nursing implications<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#d-nursing-implications" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Assess neuromuscular status with provision of safety measures if side effects occur</li>
<li>Keep atropine sulfate handy for an emergency to counteract drug effects</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="e-common-drugs">E. Common drugs<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#e-common-drugs" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Edrophonium chloride (Tensilon)</li>
<li>Neostigmine methylsulfate (Prostigmin)</li>
<li>Pyridostigmine bromide (Regonol)</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="cholinergic-blocking-agents">CHOLINERGIC BLOCKING AGENTS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#cholinergic-blocking-agents" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="i-anticholinergic-agents">I. Anticholinergic agents<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#i-anticholinergic-agents" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="a-action-compete-with-acetylcholine-at-muscarinic-receptors">A. Action: compete with acetylcholine at muscarinic receptors<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#a-action-compete-with-acetylcholine-at-muscarinic-receptors" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="b-uses">B. Uses<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#b-uses" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>Preoperatively to reduce salivation and gastric secretions</li>
<li>Parkinson’s disease symptoms</li>
<li>Motion sickness</li>
<li>Gastrointestinal spasms, urinary spasms</li>
<li>Reverse heart blocks</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="c-major-side-effects">C. Major side effects<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#c-major-side-effects" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>Dry mouth</li>
<li>Blurred vision, dilated pupils</li>
<li>Flushed skin color, decreased sweating, intolerance to heat</li>
<li>Constipation, urinary retention</li>
<li>Confusion, delusional status</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="d-interact-with-cns-depressants-antidysrhythmics-antihistamines">D. Interact with CNS depressants, antidysrhythmics, antihistamines<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#d-interact-with-cns-depressants-antidysrhythmics-antihistamines" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="e-nursing-implications">E.
